title: Quarkus spring-boot-properties extension unable to handle complex configuration.

labels.name: area/spring
labels.description: Issues relating to the Spring integration

body:
### Describe the bug

When trying to use the [swedenconnect/signservice](https://github.com/swedenconnect/signservice) library with Quarkus and the quarkus-spring-boot-properties extension for reading the signservice configuration file
an exception is thrown. This tells us that `se.swedenconnect.signservice.core.config.HandlerConfiguration` must contain a no-args constructor, but this is not a class but an interface and cannot have a constructor. It seems that the spring-boot-properties extension makes a decision to run the interface through the extension's class handling code. 



### Expected behavior

We expected the quarkus-spring-boot-properties extension to handle the configuration the same way an actual spring-boot ConfigurationProperties annotation does. I.e, read the configuration file and setup a configuration class. This  can be seen/tested in/with the [signservice/demo-apps](https://github.com/swedenconnect/signservice/tree/main/demo-apps)

### Actual behavior

Throws

```posh

``` 

### How to Reproduce?

A minimal Quarkus starter app with the quarkus-spring-boot-properties, quarkus-config-yaml extension and the needed swedenconnect/signservice bom and configuration can be found at [dagosec/code-with-quarkus](https://github.com/dagosec/code-with-quarkus)

1. Clone above starter app
2. ./mvnw clean install

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Tested on WSL(5.15.79.1-Microsoft-standard-WSL2 x86_64 GNU/Linux) and Apple(22.2.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.2.0) 

### Output of `java -version`

Tested with both java 17 and java 19

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.15.3.Final and 2.16.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Maven 3.8.7 and Maven 3.8.6

### Additional information

_No response_
